discussion.content:
C. Risk management is the MOST important aspect of an IT governance framework to ensure that IT supports repeatable business processes.

Effective risk management is critical to ensuring that IT operations align with the business goals and objectives. A comprehensive risk management framework identifies, assesses, and mitigates risks associated with IT operations. This helps to ensure that IT resources are deployed in a way that supports repeatable business processes while minimizing disruptions to operations.

While resource management, quality management, and earned value management are also important aspects of IT governance, they are not as critical as risk management when it comes to ensuring that IT supports repeatable business processes.

questions.question_text: The MOST important aspect of an IT governance framework to ensure that IT supports repeatable business processes is:

choices.A: Reviewing and evaluating existing business cases
choices.C: Publishing the IT approval process online for wider scrutiny
choices.D: Implementing a review and approval process for each phase

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Implementing a review and approval process for each phase would be the best approach to improve an enterprise's ability to manage large IT investment projects. This ensures that each phase of the project undergoes thorough scrutiny and approval before progressing to the next stage. This phased approach enhances project governance, reduces the likelihood of issues going unnoticed, and allows for adjustments based on lessons learned during earlier phases.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would BEST help to improve an enterprise's ability to manage large IT investment projects?
Which of the following is the BEST approach to assist an enterprise in planning for IT-enabled investments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Enterprise architecture is the BEST approach to assist an enterprise in planning for IT-enabled investments. Enterprise architecture provides a holistic view of an organization's structure, processes, systems, and technologies. It helps align IT strategies with business goals, ensures consistency in decision-making, and guides the planning and execution of IT-enabled investments. Through enterprise architecture, organizations can optimize their IT investments by considering the broader context of the entire enterprise, fostering interoperability, and supporting strategic decision-making.
